revision.text:
{{Multiple issues|{{refimprove|date=March 2017}}{{Orphan|date=April 2017}}}} The '''International Kodály Seminar''' was named after the famous Hungarian musician, ''[[Zoltán Kodály]]'', who was a composer, pedagogue, ethnomusicologist. He is well-known around the world as the creator of a music method: ''[[Kodály method]]''. Foreign musicians from all over the world come to see his birthplace, ''Kecskemét'' to get some inspiration, learn his method for a better pedagogy and listen to Hungarian choirs and concerts. These are the main points for musicians to visit ''[[Kecskemét]], Bács-Kiskun county''.
==History== 1970 was the year when the name and the event was born. ''Zoltán Kodály''<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bacstudastar.hu/kz-csaladja|title=KZ családja - Bácstudástár|accessdate=2017-03-31|work=www.bacstudastar.hu|language=hu-HU}}</ref>''’s widow'' and the primary and secondary Kodály school’s director, [http://www.parlando.hu/Nemesszegi.htm ''Márta'' ''Nemesszeghyné Szentkirályi''] had an idea about an international summer course. For their initiation the city advertised this course for learning the Hungarian music teaching in schools and the method’s basics. A lot of people interested in this course, so after two years the International Kodály Seminar was held again, second time. The first was in 1970 and the second, two years later, in 1972.
Since 1975, ''the [http://www.kodaly-inst.hu/en Kodály Institute of the Liszt Ferenc Academy]'' was active, they started organising the third Kodály Seminar. /The Seminar is organized every second year. An International Music Festival is also held at the same time./ While the first two courses’ main goal was for foreign professional musicians and was about the school teaching in music schools, since 1975 there was a big change, because they wanted to make the courses interesting for the Hungarian pedagogues too.
Their programmes, variations of opportunities was also motivating for the Hungarian audience. The aim of the Kodály Seminars was that: refreshing the possibilities, abilities to help the music teachers, conductors in their daily work. Kodály Seminar became year by year a voluntary self-education course; how to be a “good musician” and the human and professional music symbol.
Nowadays the aim of these courses is the comprehensive demonstration of the Hungarian music education in practical and pedagogical works, Kodály’s and [[Béla Bartók|Bartók]]’s lifework. The programme consists of daily conducting lessons, solfege lessons, methodology classes, choral singing and concerts.
In 1987 with the Seminar the International Kodály Symposium was held; a new summer programme started. Workshops were in different topics: folk music, music analysis.
The 20th International Kodály Seminar was held in 1999 which was the [http://www.bacstudastar.hu/image/image_gallery?uuid=f0a0ba33-a626-4625-8885-03ab84d75231&groupId=10804&t=1330598852454 Jubilee] of the tradition since 1970.
There have been approximately 2200 participants from 42 different countries during the Seminars.
In this year (17-28 July 2017) will be the 29th International Kodaly Seminar with a lot of programmes and concerts.
==References== <references />
==External links== * http://www.bacstudastar.hu/kz-szeminariumok
[[Category:Music conferences]] {{Improve categories|date=June 2018}}

'''La Paulée de Meursault''' is a lunch celebrating the end of the [[grape]] harvest in [[Burgundy wine|Burgundy]], [[France]].<ref name=sl>Steinberger, Mike, ''Slate.com'' (December 15, 2006). [http://www.slate.com/id/2155249/ Days of Wine...and More Wine]</ref> Originally, the celebration included only [[winemaker]]s, cellar workers, and the surrounding community. It has since evolved to become an international [[wine]] event, and an integral part of ''Les Trois Glorieuses'', which also includes a charity auction held at the [[Hospices de Beaune]] and a formal dinner at the [[Clos de Vougeot]]. Approximately 700 people attend the lunch, held in the Château de Meursault.<ref>''The New York Times'': Diner's Journal (November 28, 2006). [http://dinersjournal.blogs.nytimes.com/2006/11/28/la-paulee La Paulée]</ref>
The event was formally organized in the mid-1920s by the Count Lafon.<ref name=sl/> Traditionally, the winemakers would compete to bring the best bottle of wine to impress their favorite clients.<ref>{{cite book |title=Burgundy: A comprehensive guide to the producers, appellations and wines|last=Parker |first=Robert |year=1990 |publisher=Simon & Schuster |isbn=0-671-63378-3 |page=235 }}</ref> In the modern era, [[Domaine des Comtes Lafon|Dominique Lafon]], grandson of Count Lafon, participates in and helps organize the event.
==Other Paulées== Since 2000, [[Daniel Johnnes]] has been hosting La Paulée de New York and La Paulée de San Francisco, which have been officially recognized by the organizers of the original La Paulée de Meursault.{{fact|date=August 2018}} A celebration of the greatest [[wines of Burgundy]], Johnnes' version of La Paulée features seminars, [[wine tasting|tastings]], and [[food and wine pairing|wine-paired]] dinners, culminating in the Saturday Grand Tasting and Gala Dinner. [[Financial Times]] has asserted that La Paulée "can reasonably be described as the greatest Bacchanalia on the face of the earth".<ref>{{cite web|last=Steinberger|first=Michael|title=Bacchanalian antics in the Big Apple|url=http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/0/5768553c-d420-11db-83d5-000b5df10621.html#axzz22nQqb8Ee|work=Financial Times|publisher=Pearson PLC|accessdate=7 August 2012}}</ref>
==Etymology== The name "La Paulée" comes from the French word for sauté pan, ''poile''. In its earliest incarnations, the post-harvest meal was so simple that it was cooked in a single ''poile''.<ref>Stone, Larry, ''The Atlantic'' (January 21, 2011). [https://www.theatlantic.com/food/archive/2011/01/traditional-burgundy-bacchanal-returns-to-new-york-city/69964/ Traditional Burgundy Bacchanal Returns to New York City]</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.lapaulee.com Official website for La Paulée de New York]
{{DEFAULTSORT:La Paulee de Meursault}} [[Category:History of Burgundy]] [[Category:Burgundy wine]] [[Category:Wine-related events]] [[Category:Food and drink festivals in France]] [[Category:Wine festivals]]

[[File:Tsethar Dilgo Khyentse Yangsi Rinpoche Face.jpg|thumb|[[Dilgo Khyentse Yangsi Rinpoche]] blessing a Canadian crab prior to release.]] {{Buddhism}} '''Life release''' is a traditional [[Buddhist]] practise of saving the lives of beings that were destined for slaughter.<ref>[http://www.shabkar.org/donation/ Tsethar - The Practice of Saving Lives]</ref> This practise is performed by all schools of Buddhism: [[Theravada]], [[Mahayana]] and [[Vajrayana]].<ref name=khordong>[http://www.khordong.de/news/blogs/index.php?blog=3&title=tsethar_for_taklung_tsetrul_rinpoche&more=1&c=1&tb=1&pb=1 Tsethar for Taklung Tsetrul Rinpoche] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130412075312/http://www.khordong.de/news/blogs/index.php?blog=3&title=tsethar_for_taklung_tsetrul_rinpoche&more=1&c=1&tb=1&pb=1 |date=2013-04-12 }}</ref> It is known as "Tsethar" in [[Tibetan Buddhism]].<ref name=kagyu>{{cite web |url=http://www.kagyu.org/ktd/liferelease.php |title=Life Release |publisher=Karma Triyana Dharmachakra |author= |date= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203000250/http://www.kagyu.org/ktd/liferelease.php |archivedate=2013-12-03 |deadurl=yes}}</ref>
While this practise of life release may naturally need to be spontaneous to successfully save an endangered life, life release can also be planned. Planning often involves purchasing an animal directly from a slaughterhouse or a fishermen; this can often take place on auspicious days in the [[Buddhist calendar]] in order for the merit of the act to be multiplied thousands of times.<ref name=khordong /> Animals are blessed before being safely returned to their natural environment as [[Prayer in Buddhism|prayers]] are made and often dedicated to someone who is ill or has died, with the belief that person will benefit too from this dedication.<ref>[http://www.abuddhistlibrary.com/Buddhism/A%20-%20Tibetan%20Buddhism/Authors/Yutang%20Lin/Releasing%20Lives%20to%20Freedom/The%20Buddhist%20Practice%20of%20Releasing%20Lives%20to%20Freedom.htm The Buddhist Practice of Releasing Lives to Freedom]</ref>
In [[Tibet]] an animal is often marked by a ribbon to indicate that the life of the animal has been liberated, with the general understanding that it will be allowed to die of natural causes.<ref>[http://shambhalatimes.org/2011/06/30/a-yaks-tale-of-liberation/ Shambhala Times Community News Magazine » A Yak’s Tale of Liberation]</ref> The practise in Tibetan Buddhism has been championed in recent times by [[Chatral Rinpoche]], [[Dilgo Khyentse Yangsi Rinpoche]] and [[Ogyen Trinley Dorje]]. Although this is seen to be the traditional way of carrying out this practise, Ogyen Trinley Dorje has commented that the meaning is broad and that people can use their intelligence to expand the practise in other ways; indicating that planting one tree may be more beneficial that carrying out Tsethar for many beings.<ref name=kagyu />
It is increasingly recognized that animal release has the potential for negative environmental impacts, including as a pathway for the introduction of [[invasive species]] into non-native environments. This may lead to [[biodiversity loss]] over time.<ref>{{cite journal|work=Contemporary Buddhism |title=Buddhist Animal Release Practices: Historic, Environmental, Public Health And Economic Concerns |first=Henry |last=Shiu |first2=Leah |last2=Stokes |year=2008 |volume=9 |issue=2 | url=http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/14639940802556529 |doi=10.1080/14639940802556529}}</ref><ref name=hsi>{{cite web|url=http://www.hsi.org/issues/mercy_release/facts/mercy_release.html|title=Mercy Release |publisher=[[Humane Society International]]}}</ref> For example, competition from American [[Red-eared slider]] turtles released in China's lakes has been reported to cause death of native turtles.
Further, some animals are captured for the explicit purpose of being released, or are released into environments where they are unable to survive.<ref name=hsi />
== See also == * [[Merit (Buddhism)#Merit release|Merit release]]
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Buddhist practices]] [[Category:Animal welfare]] [[Category:Animal festival or ritual]]

{| class="infobox" style="width:22em; font-size: 88%; text-align:center;" |+ [[Beyoncé]] concert tours |- {{!}} style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" {{!}} [[File:Beyonce at Barclays Center 2013.jpg|230px]]
Beyoncé performing during [[The Mrs. Carter Show World Tour]] in August 2013. After its completion of 132 shows, the tour went on to become Beyoncé's second highest grossing of her career, producing US $229.7 million in revenue. |- {{!}}- style="background-color:#f4c0d7 ! scope="row" style="padding:.1em .3em; text-align:left;" {{!}} [[#Concert tours|↙]]Concert tours {{!}} style="background-color:#f4c0d7; width:33%;" {{!}} 8 {{!}}- style="background-color:#d0e5f5;" ! scope="row" style="padding:.1em .3em; text-align:left;" {{!}} [[#Concert residencies|↙]]Concert residencies {{!}} style="background-color:#d0e5f5; width:33%;" {{!}} 3 {{!}}- style="background-color:#ACE5EE;" ! scope="row" style="padding:.1em .3em; text-align:left;" {{!}} [[#Concerts|↙]]Concerts {{!}} style="background-color:#ACE5EE; width:33%;" {{!}} 8 {{!}}- style="background-color:#F5FAFF;" ! scope="row" style="padding:.1em .3em; text-align:left;" {{!}} [[#Live performances|↙]]Live performances {{!}} style="background: #F5FAFF; width:33%;" {{!}} 49 |} American singer [[Beyoncé]] has embarked on seven [[Concert#Concert tour|concert tours]] during her solo career, five of which have been worldwide and one of which have been collaborative as well as one of which being just in Europe.{{refn|group=nb|The tours and performances by Beyoncé within the group [[Destiny's Child]] are not included.}} Her solo tour debut (whilst on hiatus with [[Destiny's Child]]) began in 2003, with the [[Dangerously in Love Tour]]. Based predominantly in the United Kingdom, the tour received an unfavorable review from Dave Simpson of ''[[The Guardian]]'' based on Beyoncé's costumes and a confusion of her core audience at the time.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2003/nov/04/popandrock3|title=Beyoncé, Manchester Arena|work=[[The Guardian]]|first=Dave|last=Simpson|date=November 4, 2003|accessdate=May 28, 2012}} In 2007, she embarked on her first major solo world tour – [[The Beyoncé Experience]], following Destiny's Child's disbandment in 2005. The tour visited five continents and Beyoncé was lauded by [[music critics|music journalism]] for her simultaneous dancing and singing abilities. Following the release of her 2008 third studio album ''[[I Am... Sasha Fierce]]'', Beyoncé embarked on her next world concert venture, the [[I Am... World Tour]]. She collaborated with [[Thierry Mugler]] exclusively for the tour's costumes. The I Am... World Tour also marked the first time Beyoncé had performed in [[South America]]n countries.{{cite web|url=http://www.pollstar.com/blogs/news/archive/2009/12/16/702068.aspx|title=Beyoncé South America Bound|date=December 16, 2009|accessdate=January 26, 2010|work=[[Pollstar]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100125103209/http://www.pollstar.com/blogs/news/archive/2009/12/16/702068.aspx|archivedate=January 25, 2010|df=}} Beyoncé saw her largest tour to date with 2013-2014's [[The Mrs. Carter Show World Tour]]. Grossing [[United States dollar|US $]]229,727,960, the 132 date venture was criticised for the name of the tour, as Beyoncé appeared to be letting herself be known as simply [[Jay-Z|Shawn "Jay-Z" Carter]]'s wife, despite being proclaimed as a "modern-day feminist".{{cite news|url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/browbeat/2013/02/04/beyonc_s_mrs_carter_show_world_tour_why_use_her_married_name.html|title=Who Run the World? Husbands?|work=[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]]|publisher=[[Graham Holdings Company]]|first=Aisha|last=Harris|date=February 4, 2013|accessdate=July 10, 2014}} The tour itself however was lauded by music critics, who again praised Beyoncé's performance abilities and the more advanced production seen compared to her previous tours.{{cite web|url=http://www.idolator.com/7467592/beyonce-mrs-carter-show-live-review|title=Beyonce Raises The Bar At Staples Center: The Mrs. Carter Show Reviewed|publisher=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]. [[Spin Media]]|first=Mike|last=Wass|date=June 29, 2013|accessdate=June 29, 2013}}{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/reviews/gig-review-behold-beyonc-the-cybernetic-goddess-of-rb-8590792.html|title=Gig review: Behold Beyoncé, the cybernetic goddess of R&B|work=[[The Independent]]|publisher=Independent Print Limited|first=Nick|last=Hasted|date=April 26, 2013|accessdate=April 28, 2013}} In 2016 Beyoncé saw her most successful tour to date, [[The Formation Tour]] grossing more than U$260.000.000 in just 49 shows. Beside her solo live performances, Beyoncé has also embarked on two collaborative tours. In 2004, she embarked on [[The Verizon Ladies First Tour]] in which she co-headlined with [[Alicia Keys]] and [[Missy Elliott]]. Beyoncé and Keys were widely regarded as the stars of the North American show, although generally, music critics praised the entire ensemble.{{cite news|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,604994,00.html|title=Tour Report: Ladies First|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|author=Drumming, Neil|date=April 2, 2004|accessdate=July 15, 2011|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/60DQtt8mO?url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,604994,00.html|archivedate=July 16, 2011|deadurl=yes|df=}} In 2014, Beyoncé took part in her second collaborative tour; the [[On the Run Tour (Beyoncé and Jay-Z)|On the Run Tour]], in which she was co-headlining with her aforementioned husband, Jay-Z. The all-[[stadium]] tour that took place predominantly in North America as well as two performances in Paris, France, came after both Beyoncé and Jay-Z had finished their own solo tours. The tour was commended for its extensive theme and cinematic storyline, as well as both performers onstage abilities.{{cite news|url=https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/music/2014/07/10/beyonc_jay_z_raise_bar_on_dual_concerts_review.html|title=Beyoncé, Jay Z raise bar on dual concerts: review|work=[[Toronto Star]]|first=Graham|last=Slaughter|date=July 10, 2014|accessdate=July 10, 2014}} It grossed US $109.7 million, ranking as the fifth highest grossing tour of 2014. Outside of extensive world tours, Beyoncé has also performed a variety of [[concert residency|concert residencies]] and smaller, promotional tours. 2009's [[I Am... Yours]] was carried out amongst the time the I Am... World Tour was ongoing.{{cite news|url=http://www.lvrj.com/neon/52169137.html|title=Beyoncé creating a special show for cozy Encore theater|date=July 31, 2009|accessdate=December 18, 2009|last=Weatherford|first=Mike|work=[[Las Vegas Review-Journal]]|publisher=Stephens Media, LLC}} Other residencies include [[4 Intimate Nights with Beyoncé]], carried out in August 2011 to promote Beyoncé's fourth studio album ''[[4 (Beyoncé album)|4]]'', and 2012's [[Revel Presents: Beyoncé Live]], regarded as her postbirth comeback performance, after giving birth in January 2012.{{cite news|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/beyonce-announces-first-live-dates-since-giving-birth-20120319|title=Beyonce Announces First Live Dates Since Giving Birth|work=[[Rolling Stone]]|publisher=|date=March 19, 2012|accessdate=May 28, 2012}} In 2013, Beyoncé headlined the [[Super Bowl XLVII halftime show]], performing a medley of her solo and Destiny's Child recordings (with the latter reuniting on stage for a surprise performance).{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-21319757|title=Super Bowl: Beyonce wows at half-time show|publisher=[[BBC Online]]. [[BBC]]|date=February 4, 2013|accessdate=March 21, 2013}} Generating 110.8 million viewers, the performance is currently the fifth most watched halftime show of all time in the United States, behind [[Katy Perry]], [[Bruno Mars]], [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], [[Coldplay]] and [[Lady Gaga]].{{cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/news/tv-film/5893897/bruno-mars-scores-most-watched-super-bowl-halftime-show-ever|title=Bruno Mars Scores Most-Watched Super Bowl Halftime Show Ever|author=Phil Gallo|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=February 3, 2014|accessdate=February 8, 2014}}{{cite web | url=http://money.cnn.com/2016/02/08/media/super-bowl-50-ratings/ | title=Super Bowl 50 audience is third largest in TV history | work=CNN Money | date=February 8, 2016 | accessdate=February 28, 2016}} She was featured as a special guest during Coldplay's performance at the [[Super Bowl 50 halftime show|show in 2016]] along with Bruno Mars. ==Concert tours== {|class="wikitable" ! style="background:silver;"| Year !! style="background:silver;"| Title !! style="background:silver;"| Duration !! style="background:silver;"| Number of

|- | colspan="5" style="border-bottom-width:3px; padding:5px;" | Serving as Beyoncé's first worldwide solo tour, The Beyoncé Experience supported her second studio album, ''[[B'Day (Beyoncé album)|B'Day]]'' (2006). The tour featured an all female band under the name "Suga Mama", chosen by Beyoncé after holding auditions prior to the tour's beginning.{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2007/08/05/review-review-music-beyonce-dc-idUSN0524579820070805 |title=Beyonce dazzles Garden audience with pop-diva goods |first=Frank |last=Scheck |date=August 5, 2007 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] ''via [[Reuters]]''|accessdate=July 18, 2011}} Unlike her first solo tour, Beyoncé was praised by music critics for her onstage performance abilities, including her execution of simultaneous singing and dancing.{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/entertainment/music/queen-of-pop-brilliant-beyonce-is-brash-but-fun-26296674.html|title=Queen of pop: brilliant Beyonce is brash but fun|work=[[Irish Independent]]|publisher=[[Independent News & Media]]|first=Eamon|last=Sweeney|date=June 11, 2007|accessdate=July 8, 2013}} Shaheem Reid of MTV News commented on The Beyoncé Experience stating, "There are few (very few) ladies out there who can really sing, a lot who can dance, a lot more who look good — but really no other who can combine all three and add iconic star power like [Beyoncé], arguably the best all-around stage performer in the game right now." The show was filmed on September 2, 2007 at the [[Staples Center]] in [[Los Angeles, California]].{{cite news|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2007/10/22/beyonce-to-release-live-dvd/|title=Beyoncé to Release 'LIVE!' DVD|work=[[Rap-Up]]|date=October 22, 2007|accessdate=May 25, 2013}} It was released as the [[live album]] ''[[The Beyoncé Experience Live]]'' on November 20, 2007.{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B000X1YDCM|title=The Beyonce Experience Live [DVD]|publisher=[[Amazon.com]] (UK)|accessdate=November 3, 2007}} |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" width=5 | 2009–2010 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| [[I Am... World Tour was Beyoncé's second worldwide tour and served as the first time she had toured in South America. The singer collaborated exclusively with [[Thierry Mugler]] for her tour costumes, as well as those of her band and dancers.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1609546/beyonce-announces-us-tour-dates.jhtml|title=Beyonce Announces U.S. Tour Dates|author=Gil Kaufman|date=April 20, 2009|publisher=MTV News. MTV Networks|accessdate=March 30, 2011}} She commented that performing in the "elaborate" outfits was a hard-point of the tour. Critics provided favorable reviews for the tour's energetic performances, praising the singer's vocal performances, dance choreographs and the different songs present on the set list.{{cite news|title=Beyoncé, 02 Arena, London:Diva who answers the call of booty|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/reviews/beyonc-02-arena-london-1691069.html|last=Jones|first=Alice|work=The Independent|publisher=Independent Print Limited|date=May 27, 2009|accessdate=September 5, 2014}}{{cite news|last=Ratliff|first=Ben|title=Flash, Concepts and, Yes, Songs|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/06/23/arts/music/23beyonce.html|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=June 22, 2009|accessdate=September 5, 2014}} The I Am... World Tour earned US $119.5 million becoming Beyoncé's highest grossing tour at that time.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/meghancasserly/2012/12/10/beyonce-knowles-50-million-pepsi-deal-takes-creative-cues-from-jay-z/|title=Beyoncé's $50 Million Pepsi Deal Takes Creative Cues From Jay Z|work=Forbes|publisher=Forbes publishing|first=Meghan|last=Casserly|date=December 10, 2012|accessdate=September 5, 2014}} It was filmed in various cities throughout the world and on November 30, 2010, a live DVD/CD concert film named ''[[I Am... World Tour (album)|I Am... World Tour]]'' was released.{{cite press release|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/music-worldcolumbia-records-releasing-beyonces-i-amworld-tour-the-new-full-length-dvd-concert-film-experience-produced-directed--edited-by-beyonce-for-her-own-parkwood-pictures-106424558.html|title=Music World/Columbia Records Releasing Beyonce's I Am...World Tour, The New Full-Length DVD|location=New York|publisher=PR Newswire PR Newswire Association LLC|date=2010-11-01|accessdate=2010-11-03}} |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" width=5 | 2013-2014 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| [[The Mrs. Carter Show World Tour]] || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| April 15, 2013 – March 27, 2014 (Worldwide)||style="background-color: #DCDCDC;"|

The tour was Beyoncé's third consecutive worldwide concert tour venture and also became her longest running, spanning over 2013-2014. The 2013 shows of the tour were recognised as not having a specific supporting album (with her latest studio album ''[[4 (Beyoncé album)|4]]'', 2011, being two years old at the time).{{cite web|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/music/ci_23590307/setlist-beyonce-san-jose|title=Setlist: Beyonce in San Jose|work=[[San Jose Mercury News]]|date=July 3, 2013|archiveurl=http://www.freezepage.com/1373080918QQTCSOUBQY?url=http://www.mercurynews.com/music/ci_23590307/setlist-beyonce-san-jose|archivedate=July 6, 2013}} However, in December 2013, Beyoncé's fifth studio album ''[[Beyoncé (album)|Beyoncé]]'' was unexpectedly released and the 2014 shows of the tour predominantly supported this album within the set list.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-26383976|title=Jay-Z joins Beyonce show in London|publisher=BBC News. Spin Media|first=Mike|last=Wass|date=March 28, 2014|accessdate=July 9, 2014}} [[HBO]] aired ''Beyoncé: X10'': A ten episode series of four-minute performance segments from different songs during the tour.{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2014/06/19/beyonce-returns-to-hbo-for-x10-concert-series/|title=Beyoncé Returns to HBO for 'X10' Concert Series|work=Rap–Up|date=June 19, 2014|accessdate=June 30, 2014}} |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" width=5 | 2014 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| [[On the Run Tour (Beyoncé and Jay-Z)|On the Run Tour]] || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | June 25, 2014 – September 13, 2014 (USA, Canada, France)||style="background-color: #DCDCDC;"|

|- | colspan="5" style="border-bottom-width:3px; padding:5px;" | The On the Run Tour was the all [[stadium]]-tour, headlined by Beyoncé and her husband [[Jay-Z]] (whom she married in 2008). The tour was critically lauded for its movie-style theme and cinematic production. Both Beyoncé and Jay-Z were critically praised also for their onstage performance abilities, with critics commending Beyoncé for her intricate choreographies with her background dancers and Jay-Z for holding the stage and working the crowd alone. However, some felt the potential chemistry and "banter" between the couple was not what it could have been on stage.{{cite web|url=http://citybeat.com/cincinnati/blog-5767-review_jay_z_and_beyonc%C3%A9_at_great_american_ballpark.html|title=REVIEW: Jay Z and Beyoncé at Great American Ballpark|work=[[Cincinnati CityBeat]]|first=Jac|last=Kern|date=June 30, 2014|accessdate=July 5, 2014}} $1 from each ticket sold went to the "Shawn Carter Foundation" set up to "help and support existing students of the foundation that represent diverse backgrounds, and face significant barriers to success such as teen pregnancy, homelessness, poverty, former incarceration, sexual and domestic abuse, and gang membership."{{cite web|url=http://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwmusic/article/BEYONCE-AND-JAY-Z-Announce-On-The-Run-Tour-Benefitting-the-Shawn-Carter-Foundation-20140428|title=BEYONCE AND JAY Z Announce 'On The Run Tour' Benefitting the Shawn Carter Foundation|work=Broadway World|date=April 28, 2014|accessdate=April 28, 2014}} Following the conclusion of the North American leg, ''Billboard'' reported a gross of US $96 million from 19 sold-out concerts.{{cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6243672/beyonce-jay-z-sell-out-stadium-tour|title=Beyonce & Jay Z Sell Out Stadium Tour|work=Billboard|first=Bob|last=Allen|date=September 4, 2014|accessdate=September 5, 2014}} The husband and wife co-bill of Beyoncé and Jay Z brought in $109.7 gross million, ranking at 5th highest grossing tour of 2014 with 21 total shows.{{cite press release|url=http://www.pollstarpro.com/files/charts2014/2014YearendTop20WorldwideTours.pdf|title=2014 Pollstar Year End Top 20 Worldwide Tours|work=Pollstar|accessdate=June 18, 2016}} |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" width=5 | 2016 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| [[The Formation World Tour]] || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" |

World Tour was ongoing, Beyoncé carried out a four night [[concert residency]] at the [[Encore Las Vegas|Encore at Wynn]] in [[Las Vegas]] from July 30 to August 2, 2009, under the separate show name I Am... Yours. Inspired by concerts of her favorite musical artists in the city, the singer wanted to perform a special show different from its corresponding tour only backed by a small band and several dancers.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/beyonce-concert-thanksgiving/story?id=9168086|title=Beyonce: What I'm Thankful For|publisher=[[ABC News]]. [[American Broadcasting Company]]|page=1|first=Lauren|last=Sher|date=November 25, 2009|accessdate=September 5, 2014}} A [[I Am... Yours: An Intimate Performance at Wynn Las Vegas|live DVD of the show]] was released in late November 2009 and a one-hour Thanksgiving television special which aired on [[ABC News]] followed several days later.{{cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/266828/beyonce-preps-live-release-network-special-lady-gaga-collaboration|title=Beyonce Preps Live Release, Network Special, Lady Gaga Collaboration|work=Billboard|first=Kelsey|last=Paine|date=November 3, 2009|accessdate=September 5, 2014}} |- |2011 |[[4 Intimate Nights with Beyoncé]] |In mid-August 2011, Beyoncé performed four intimate shows at New York City's [[Roseland Ballroom]] backed by a 20-piece all-female band and orchestra. For the show, the singer performed all of the songs from her fourth studio album, ''4'' (with the exception of "[[Start Over (song)|Start Over]]"), a medley consisting of songs by Destiny's Child, several older songs and a cover version of [[Michael Jackson]]'s "[[I Wanna Be Where You Are]]".{{cite news|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2011/08/15/beyonce-kicks-off-intimate-new-york-concerts-video/ |title=Beyoncé Kicks Off Intimate New York Concerts [Video] |work=Rap-Up|date=October 18, 2010 |accessdate=September 5, 2014}}{{cite news|first=Jason|last=Newman|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2011/08/15/concert-review-beyonce-reigns-at-roseland-ballroom/|title=Concert Review: Beyoncé Reigns at Roseland Ballroom|work=Rap-Up|date=August 15, 2011|accessdate=September 5, 2014}} A two-disc set ''[[Live at Roseland: Elements of 4]]'' which documented the concert was released on November 21, 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.beyonceonline.com/us/news/beyonc%C3%A9-release-live-roseland-dvd-next-month|title=Beyonce To Release 'Live At Roseland' DVD Next Month|publisher=Beyoncé's official website|date=October 26, 2011|accessdate=September 5, 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130314111631/http://www.beyonceonline.com/us/news/beyonc%C3%A9-release-live-roseland-dvd-next-month|archivedate=March 14, 2013 }} |- |2012 |[[Revel Presents: Beyoncé Live]] |Beyoncé performed four exclusive shows at [[Revel Atlantic City]] between May 25–28 to celebrate the casino's opening. The concerts were considered her comeback to the stage and the music business as the singer gave birth to her first child in January, earlier that year; another name used for the residency was Back to Business. It featured various costume changes and video projections on the screen onstage and Beyoncé was backed by an all-female band and ten dancers.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/27/arts/music/beyonces-return-to-stage-is-a-return-to-familiar-form.html|title=Beyoncé: Coming Back and Catching Up, Then Conquering|work=The New York Times|first=Ben|last=Ratliff|date=May 26, 2012|accessdate=September 2014}} Excerpts of the live performances from the show were featured in the singer's film ''[[Life Is But a Dream]]'' (2013) and a complete concert film titled ''[[Live in Atlantic City]]'' was released along with the DVD and [[Blu-ray Disc|Blu-ray]] format release of the aforementioned movie.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/news/a465460/beyonces-life-is-but-a-dream-documentary-to-air-on-bbc-one.html|title=Beyoncé's 'Life Is But A Dream' documentary to air on BBC One|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]. [[Hearst Corporation]]|first=Morgan|last=Jeffery|date=March 13, 2013|accessdate=September 2014}}{{cite press release|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/life-is-but-a-dream-to-be-released-on-dvd-on-november-25-worldwide-230249951.html|title="Life Is But A Dream" To Be Released On DVD On November 25 Worldwide|publisher=[[Parkwood Entertainment]] / Columbia Records|date=November 1, 2013|accessdate=September 5, 2014}} |- |} ==Concerts== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" width=100% |- !align="left" valign="top" width="30"| Date !align="left" valign="top" width="60"| Event !align="left" valign="top" width="200"| Notes |- |November 29, 2003 !scope="row"|[[46664]] |Dubbed "Give 1 Minute of Your Life to Stop Aids", the concert was launched along with a campaign by [[Nelson Mandela]] to raise awareness about the impact of [[AIDS]]/[[HIV]] in Africa.{{cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/68556/bono-beyonce-rock-for-aids-awareness|title=Bono, Beyonce Rock For AIDS Awareness|work=Billboard|date=October 21, 2003|accessdate=September 5, 2014}} Her set list consisted of "[[American Prayer (Bono song)|American Prayer]]" performed together with [[Bono]] and backed by [[The Edge]] and [[David A. Stewart|Dave Stewart]],{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/3249442.stm|title=Beyonce and Bono lead Aids show|publisher=[[BBC News]]. BBC|date=November 29, 2003|accessdate=September 5, 2014}} "Crazy in Love", "Baby Boy" and "Dangerously In Love". |- |June 25, 2011 !scope="row"| [[Glastonbury Festival 2011|2011 Glastonbury Festival]] |The show was part of a promotional tour Beyoncé embarked following the release of ''4''. With the performance at the festival, she became the first solo female artist to headline the Pyramid stage at the festival in more than twenty years.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.co.uk/beyonce/news/beyonce-closes-2011-glastonbury-festival|title=Beyoncé Closes 2011 Glastonbury Festival|publisher=[[MTV UK]]. MTV Networks|date=June 27, 2011|accessdate=September 5, 2014}} |- |February 3, 2013 !scope="row"| [[Super Bowl XLVII halftime show]] |This was Beyoncé's first Super Bowl halftime show performance. She invited [[Kelly Rowland]] and [[Michelle Williams (singer)|Michelle Williams]] to the stage to sing hit songs from [[Destiny's Child]]. Together they also sung Single Ladies, Beyoncé's most viewed video on YouTube. The Super Bowl halftime show caused a defect in to the power of the stadium, directly after Beyoncé finished the show. Right after the Super Bowl, Beyoncé announced her fourth solo tour [[The Mrs. Carter Show World Tour]]. |- |June 1, 2013 !scope="row"| The Sound of Change Live |A charity concert promoting worldwide female empowerment, this concert was part of a [[Gucci]] "Chime for Change" campaign and the singer's The Mrs. Carter Show World Tour.{{cite news|last=Talarico|first=Brittany|title=Katy Perry, Blake Lively Join Beyoncé and Gucci to Empower Women|url=http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2013/04/17/katy-pery-blake-lively-beyonce-gucci-campaig/|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=April 22, 2013|accessdate=September 5, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130424022452/http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2013/04/17/katy-pery-blake-lively-beyonce-gucci-campaig/|archivedate=April 24, 2013|df=}} Beyoncé performed cover versions of "[[A Change Is Gonna Come]]" and "[[At Last]]" among the set list of her own songs and was joined onstage by Jay-Z for the rendition of "Crazy in Love".{{cite news|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/beyonce-leads-a-charge-of-powerful-women-at-sound-of-change-20130601|title=Beyonce Leads a Charge of Powerful Women at Sound of Change|work=Rolling Stone|first=Mark|last=Sutherland|date=June 1, 2013|accessdate=September 5, 2014}} |- |September 5, 2015 !scope="row"| [[Budweiser Made in America Festival]] | |- |September 26, 2015 !scope="row"| [[Global Citizen Festival]] | |- |October 15, 2016 !scope="row"| [[Tidal (service)|Tidal X: 1015]] | Hosted by [[Angie Martinez]], Beyoncé headlined a charity concert at the [[Barclays Center]] in [[New York City]], in support of the [[Robin Hood Foundation]]. Other performers at the event included [[Alicia Keys]], [[Nicki Minaj]], [[Lauryn Hill]], [[Common (rapper)|Common]], [[T.I.]], [[DNCE]], [[Robin Thicke]], [[Emeli Sandé]], [[Prince Royce]], [[Dev Hynes#Blood Orange|Blood Orange]], [[Salva (music producer)|Salva]], [[Cipha Sounds]], and [[Bebe Rexha]]. The event was streamed live exclusively on [[Tidal (service)|Tidal]].{{cite web | url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/beyonce-jay-z-plot-tidal-x-1015-charity-show-in-new-york-w440287 | title=Beyonce, Jay Z Plot 'Tidal X: 1015' Charity Show in New York | publisher=[[Rolling Stone]] | date=September 21, 2016 | accessdate=September 24, 2016 | author=Brittany, Spanos}}{{cite web | url=http://www.spin.com/2016/09/tidal-beyonce-nicki-minaj-blood-orange/ | title=TIDAL Announces Charity Concert Featuring Beyoncé, Nicki Minaj, Blood Orange, and More | publisher=[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]] | date=September 21, 2016 | accessdate=September 24, 2016 | author=Josephs, Brian}} |- |[[Beyoncé 2018 Coachella performance|April 14 & 21, 2018]] !scope="row"|[[Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival]] | Beyoncé headlined the festival, after she postponed her performance in 2017 due to her pregnancy. It was Beyoncé's first live performance in over a year. The performance was a tribute to the [[Historically black colleges and universities|HBCU]] experiences and featured a full marching band and majorette dancers. The set also included aspects of [[National Pan-Hellenic Council|black Greek]] life. Beyoncé became the first Black woman to headline the festival since its inception.{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/04/15/entertainment/beyonce-coachella-performance/index.html|title=Beyoncé makes history with Coachella performance|last=CNN|first=Nicole Chavez,|work=CNN|access-date=2018-09-02}} Beyoncé was joined on-stage by husband [[Jay-Z]], [[J Balvin]], her former [[Destiny's Child]] band members, Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams, and her sister [[Solange Knowles]]. |- |} ==Live performances== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! style="width:12%;"|Date ! style="width:20%;"|Event ! style="width:10%;"|City ! revision.comment: Rescued 1 archive link; reformat 1 link. [[User:GreenC/WaybackMedic_2.1|Wayback Medic 2.1]]
revision.text:
An incomplete list of events in [[Rome]], [[Italy]].
==April== * ''Roma Sana'' - Mediterranean Trade Fair for Natural Products with exhibitions of biological products, conferences and tasting.
==June== * ''[[Republic Day]]'' - Military parade celebrating the formation of the republic on the second day of June. Takes place on the road [[Via dei Fori Imperiali]], with the "[[Frecce Tricolori]]" of the Italian Air Force.
==Summer (June to September)== * ''Roman Summers'' - Various events from music to theater, literary meetings and cinema. Events that take place in the most characteristic places in Rome that attract the participation of thousands of artists from all over the world.
==September== *''Romaeuropa Festival'' - Annual appointment for modern [[art]] and [[theatre]], [[music]] and [[dance]], with artists from all of [[Europe]].
==October== * [http://www.romacinemafest.org Roma Cinema Fest] - film festival * ''Festival Romics'' - Comics and Cartoon Festival: exhibitions, cartoon film showings of designers and publishing companies. * [http://www.romajazzfestival.it/ Roma Jazz Festival] - Festival of jazz music since of 1876 with Italian and international artists.
==White Night== [[Image:Rome White Night by jmx.jpg|left|250px|thumb|[https://www.flickr.com/photos/joaomaximo/192939409/ White night by jmax@flickr]]]
Series of events at venues throughout Rome in September: concerts, special outdoor performances, churches and monuments open to the public at this time, museums open all night with free entrance, shops open all night. See [[Nuit Blanche]] and [https://web.archive.org/web/20040804082031/http://www.lanottebianca.it/index.asp?lang=en&destinazione=cosa_ La Notte Bianca].
{{clear}}
==External links== * [http://eventseeker.com/rome Events]

{{History of Japan |periods |image=Tokyo Tower and around Skyscrapers.jpg |caption=[[Tokyo]] skyline}} The {{nihongo|'''Lost Decade''' or the '''Lost 10 Years'''|失われた十年|Ushinawareta Jūnen}} is a period of [[economic stagnation]] in [[Japan]] following the Japanese [[Japanese asset price bubble|asset price bubble]]'s collapse in late 1991 and early 1992. The term originally referred to the years from 1991 to 2000,<ref>http://fhayashi.fc2web.com/Prescott1/Postscript_2003/hayashi-prescott.pdf</ref> but recently the decade from 2001 to 2010 is often included<ref name="janacra">{{cite news|title=Japan eyes end to decades long deflation|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/08/17/japan-economy-estimate-idUSL4E8JH1TC20120817|author=Leika Kihara|publisher=Reuters|date=August 17, 2012|accessdate=September 7, 2012}}</ref> so that the whole period is referred to as the '''Lost Score''' or the '''Lost 20 Years''' (失われた二十年, ''Ushinawareta Nijūnen''). Broadly impacting the entire [[economy of Japan|Japanese economy]], over the period of 1995 to 2007, GDP fell from $5.33 trillion to $4.36 trillion in nominal terms,<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.google.ae/publicdata/explore?ds=d5bncppjof8f9_&met_y=ny_gdp_mktp_cd&hl=en&dl=en#!ctype=l&strail=false&bcs=d&nselm=h&met_y=ny_gdp_mktp_cd&scale_y=lin&ind_y=false&rdim=region&idim=country:JPN&ifdim=region&hl=en_US&dl=en&ind=false|title = Japanese GDP, nominal|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref> [[real wages]] fell around 5%,<ref name=":0">{{cite news|url = https://www.economist.com/news/finance-and-economics/21573133-shinzo-abe-wakes-up-political-risk-higher-prices-without-higher|title = Waging a New War|last = |first = |date = March 9, 2013|work = |accessdate = }}</ref> while the country experienced a stagnant price level.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.inflation.eu/inflation-rates/japan/historic-inflation/cpi-inflation-japan.aspx|title = Inflation Japan - CPI inflation|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref> While there is some debate on the extent and measurement of Japan's setbacks,<ref name="fingleton1">{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/01/08/opinion/sunday/the-true-story-of-japans-economic-success.html?ref=opinion&pagewanted=all-- | work=The New York Times | title=The Myth of Japan’s Failure | first=Eamonn | last=Fingleton | date=January 6, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/programmes/newsnight/9677356.stm | work=BBC News, 5 min. 26 sec| title=Video interview on BBC News with Eamonn Fingleton | first=Eamonn | last=Fingleton | date=January 12, 2012}}</ref> the economic effect of the Lost Decade is well established and Japanese policymakers continue to grapple with its consequences.
==Causes== [[File:Japan federal funds rate.png|thumb|300px|[[Bank of Japan|BOJ]] monetary policy causing recessions in Japan]] Japan's [[Japanese economic miracle|strong economic growth]] in the second half of the 20th century ended abruptly at the start of the 1990s. The Plaza Accord doubling of the exchange rate value of the dollar versus the yen between 1985 to 1987 fueled a speculative [[Japanese asset price bubble|asset price bubble]] of a massive scale. The bubble was caused by the excessive loan growth quotas dictated on the banks by Japan's central bank, the [[Bank of Japan]], through a policy mechanism known as the "window guidance".<ref>{{Cite book|title = New Paradigm in Macroeconomics|url = http://www.palgraveconnect.com/doifinder/10.1057/9780230506077|doi = 10.1057/9780230506077|first = Richard|last = Werner}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|doi=10.1111/1467-8381.00145 | volume=16 | issue=2 | title=Monetary Policy Implementation in Japan: What They Say versus What They Do | journal=Asian Economic Journal | pages=111–151 | last1 = Werner | first1 = Richard A.}}</ref> As economist [[Paul Krugman]] explained, "Japan's banks lent more, with less regard for quality of the borrower, than anyone else's. In doing so they helped inflate the bubble economy to grotesque proportions."<ref name="Krugman 2009" />
Trying to deflate speculation and keep inflation in check, the [[Bank of Japan]] sharply raised inter-bank lending rates in late 1989.<ref>{{Cite news|url = https://www.nytimes.com/1989/12/25/business/japan-raises-interest-rates.html|title = Japan Raised Interest Rates|last = |first = |date = December 25, 1989|work = Reuters via The New York Times|accessdate = }}</ref> This sharp policy caused the bursting of the bubble and the Japanese stock market crashed. Equity and asset prices fell, leaving overly leveraged Japanese banks and insurance companies with books full of bad debt. The financial institutions were bailed out through capital infusions from the [[Government of Japan|government]], loans and cheap credit from the central bank, and the ability to postpone the recognition of losses, ultimately turning them into [[zombie bank]]s. [[Yalman Onaran]] of [[Bloomberg News]] writing in ''[[Salon (website)|Salon]]'' stated that the zombie banks were one of the reasons for the following long stagnation.<ref name="salon1">{{cite news|url=http://www.salon.com/2011/11/25/kill_the_zombie_banks/|title= Kill the zombie banks! |last=Onaran|first=Yalman|date=2011-11-25|publisher=Salon Media Groupn|accessdate=2013-01-16}}</ref> Additionally Michael Schuman of ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine noted that these banks kept injecting new funds into unprofitable "[[Zombie company|zombie firms]]" to keep them afloat, arguing that they were [[too big to fail]]. However, most of these companies were too debt-ridden to do much more than survive on bail-out funds. Schuman believed that Japan's economy did not begin to recover until this practice had ended.<ref name="schumantimes">{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/business/article/0,8599,1867847,00.html|title= Why Detroit Is Not Too Big to Fail|last=Schuman|first=Michael|date=2008-12-19|publisher=Time Inc.|accessdate=2008-12-23}}</ref>
Eventually, many of these failing firms became unsustainable, and a wave of consolidation took place, resulting in four national banks in Japan<!---compared to what?--->. Many Japanese firms were burdened with heavy debts, and it became very difficult to obtain credit. Many borrowers turned to [[sarakin]] (loan sharks) for loans. As of 2012, the official interest rate was 0.1%;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.grips.ac.jp/teacher/oono/hp/lecture_J/lec13.htm|title=Economic Development of Japan|last=Ohno|first=Kenichi|publisher=[[National Graduate Institute for Policy Studies]]|accessdate=3 April 2011}}</ref> the interest rate has remained below 1% since 1994.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.stat-search.boj.or.jp/ssi/cgi-bin/famecgi2?cgi=$graphwnd_en|title = Bank of Japan Interest Rates|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref>
==Effects<!---cite?---><!---compared to what?--->== Despite mild economic recovery in the 2000s, [[conspicuous consumption]] of the 1980s has not returned to the same pre-crash levels. Difficult times in the 1990s made people frown on ostentatious displays of wealth, while Japanese firms such as [[Toyota]] and [[Sony]] which had dominated their respective industries in the 1980s had to fend off strong competition from rival firms based in other East Asian countries, particularly [[South Korea]]. Many Japanese companies replaced a large part of their workforce with temporary workers, who had little job security and fewer benefits. As of 2009, these non-traditional employees made up more than a third of the labor force.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/02/22/business/worldbusiness/22japan.html?fta=y | work=The New York Times | title=When Consumers Cut Back: An Object Lesson From Japan | first=Hiroko | last=Tabuchi | date=2009-02-22 | accessdate=2010-05-11}}</ref> For the wider Japanese workforce, wages have stagnated. From their peak in 1997, real wages have since fallen around 13%<ref name=":0" />—an unprecedented number among developed nations.{{citation needed|date=September 2016}}
The wider economy of Japan is still recovering from the impact of the 1991 crash and subsequent lost decades. It took 12 years for Japan's GDP to recover to the same levels as 1995. And as a greater sign of economic malaise, Japan also fell behind in output per capita. In 1991, real output per capita in Japan was 14% higher than that of Australia, but in 2011 real output had dropped to 14% below Australia's levels.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url = https://www.economist.com/blogs/freeexchange/2012/08/lost-decades|title = The Japanese Tragedy|last = |first = |date = |work = The Economist Blog|accessdate = }}</ref> In the span of 20 years, Japan's economy was overtaken not only in gross output, but labor efficiency, whereas previously it was a global leader in both.
In response to chronic deflation and low growth, Japan has attempted economic stimulus and thereby run a fiscal deficit since 1991.<ref name=":2">{{Cite news|url = https://www.economist.com/news/finance-and-economics/21577080-shinzo-abes-government-looks-likely-disappoint-fiscal-consolidation-dont|title = Don't Mention the Debt|last = |first = |date = May 4, 2013|work = |accessdate = }}</ref> These economic stimuli have had at best nebulous effects on the Japanese economy and have contributed to the huge debt burden on the Japanese government. Expressed as a percentage of GDP, at 240% Japan has the highest level of debt of any nation on earth.<ref name=":2" /> While Japan's is a special case where the majority of public debt is held in the domestic market and by the Bank of Japan, the sheer size of the debt demands large service payments and is a worrying sign of the country's financial health.
==Interpretation== Economist [[Paul Krugman]] has argued that Japan's lost decade is an example of a [[liquidity trap]] (a situation in which monetary policy is unable to lower nominal interest rates because these are close to zero). He explained how truly massive the asset bubble was in Japan by 1990, with a tripling of land and stock market prices during the prosperous 1980s. Japan's high personal savings rates, driven in part by the demographics of an aging population, enabled Japanese firms to rely heavily on traditional bank loans from supporting banking networks, as opposed to issuing stock or bonds via the capital markets to acquire funds. The cozy relationship of corporations to banks and the implicit guarantee of a taxpayer bailout of bank deposits created a significant [[moral hazard]] problem, leading to an atmosphere of [[crony capitalism]] and reduced lending standards. In so doing they helped inflate the bubble economy to grotesque proportions." The Bank of Japan began increasing interest rates in 1990 due in part to concerns over the bubble and in 1991 land and stock prices began a steep decline, within a few years reaching 60% below their peak.<ref name="Krugman 2009">{{cite book| last = Krugman| first = Paul| year = 2009| title = The Return of Depression Economics and the Crisis of 2008 | publisher = W.W. Norton Company Limited| isbn = 978-0-393-07101-6}}</ref>
Economist [[Richard Koo]] wrote that Japan's "Great Recession" that began in 1990 was a "[[balance sheet recession]]". It was triggered by a collapse in land and stock prices, which caused Japanese firms to become [[insolvent]], meaning their assets were worth less than their liabilities. Despite zero [[interest rate]]s and expansion of the money supply to encourage borrowing, Japanese corporations in aggregate opted to pay down their debts from their own business earnings rather than borrow to invest as firms typically do. Corporate investment, a key demand component of [[GDP]], fell enormously (22% of GDP) between 1990 and its peak decline in 2003. Japanese firms overall became net savers after 1998, as opposed to borrowers. Koo argues that it was massive fiscal stimulus (borrowing and spending by the government) that offset this decline and enabled Japan to maintain its level of GDP. In his view, this avoided a U.S. type [[Great Depression]], in which U.S. GDP fell by 46%. He argued that monetary policy was ineffective because there was limited demand for funds while firms paid down their liabilities. In a balance sheet recession, GDP declines by the amount of debt repayment and un-borrowed individual savings, leaving government stimulus spending as the primary remedy.<ref name="Koo 2009">{{cite book| last = Koo| first = Richard| year = 2009| title = The Holy Grail of Macroeconomics-Lessons from Japan's Great Recession | publisher = John Wiley & Sons (Asia) Pte. Ltd.| isbn = 978-0-470-82494-8}}</ref><ref>[http://www.businessinsider.com/richard-koo-recession-2010-4#-1 Presentation by Richard Koo-The Age of Balance Sheet Recessions-April 2010]</ref>
Economist Scott Sumner has argued that Japan's monetary policy was too tight during the Lost Decade and thus prolonged the pain felt by the Japanese economy.<ref>{{cite web|last=Sumner|first=Scott|title=Why Japan's QE didn't "work"|url=http://www.themoneyillusion.com/?p=9404|work=The Money Illusion|accessdate=November 24, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Sumner|first=Scott|title=More evidence that the BOJ is not trying to create inflation|url=http://www.themoneyillusion.com/?p=8091|work=The Money Illusion|accessdate=November 24, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Sumner|first=Scott|title=Rooseveltian Resolve|url=http://www.themoneyillusion.com/?p=3587|work=The Money Illusion|accessdate=November 24, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Sumner|first=Scott|title=The other money illusion|url=http://www.themoneyillusion.com/?p=6937|work=The Money Illusion|accessdate=November 24, 2014}}</ref>
Economists [[Fumio Hayashi]] and [[Edward Prescott]] argue that the anemic performance of the Japanese economy since the early 1990s is mainly due to the low growth rate of aggregate productivity. Their hypothesis stands in direct contrast to popular explanations that are based in terms of an extended credit crunch that emerged in the aftermath of a bursting asset “bubble.” They are led to explore the implications of their hypothesis on the basis of evidence that suggests that despite the ongoing difficulties in the Japanese banking sector, desired capital expenditure was for the most part fully financed. They suggest that Japan’s sluggish investment activity is likely to be better understood in terms of low levels of desired capital expenditure and not in terms of credit constraints that prohibit firms from financing projects with positive net present value (NPV). Monetary or fiscal policies might increase consumption in the short run, but unless productivity growth increases, there is a legitimate fear that such a policy may simply transform Japan from a low-growth/low-inflation economy to a low-growth/high-inflation economy.
In her analysis of Japan's gradual path to economic success and then quick reversal, Jennifer Amyx noted that Japanese experts were not unaware of the possible causes of Japan's economic decline. Rather, to return Japan's economy back to the path to economic prosperity, policymakers would have had to adopt policies that would first cause short-term harm to the Japanese people and government.<ref>{{cite book|last=Amyx|first=Jennifer|title=Japan's Financial Crisis: Institutional Rigidity and Reluctant Change|date=2004|publisher=Princeton University Press|pages=17–18}}</ref> Under this analysis, says Ian Lustick, Japan was stuck on a "local maximum," which it arrived at through gradual increases in its fitness level, set by the economic landscape of the 1970s and 80s. Without an accompanying change in institutional flexibility, Japan was unable to adapt to changing conditions and even though experts may have known which changes needed to be made, they would have been virtually powerless to enact those changes without instituting unpopular policies which would have been harmful in the short-term. Lustick's analysis is rooted in the application of [[Evolution|evolutionary theory]] and [[natural selection]] to understanding institutional rigidity in the social sciences.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Lustick|first=Ian|title=Institutional Rigidity|journal=Cliodynamics|date=2011|volume=2|issue=2}}</ref>
==Legacy== After the [[Great Recession]] of 2007–2009, many Western governments and commentators have referenced the Lost Decade as a distinct economic possibility for stagnating developed nations. On February 9, 2009, in warning of the dire consequences facing the [[United States]] [[Economy of the United States|economy]] after its [[United States housing bubble|housing bubble]], U.S. President [[Barack Obama]] cited the "lost decade" as a prospect the American economy faced.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB123419281562063867?mod=djemalertNEWS | work=The Wall Street Journal | title=Obama Warns of 'Lost Decade' | first1=Laura | last1=Meckler | first2=Jonathan | last2=Weisman | date=2009-02-10}}</ref> And in 2010, Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President [[James B. Bullard|James Bullard]] warned that the United States was in danger of becoming "enmeshed in a Japanese-style deflationary outcome within the next several years."<ref>[http://research.stlouisfed.org/publications/review/10/09/Bullard.pdf The Seven Faces of 'The Peril'"]</ref>
More than 25 years after the initial market crash, Japan is still feeling the effects of Lost Decade. However, several Japanese policymakers have attempted reforms to address the malaise in the Japanese economy. After [[Shinzō Abe|Shinzo Abe]] was elected as Japanese prime minister in December 2012, Abe introduced a reform program known as [[Abenomics]] which sought to address many of the issues raised by Japan's Lost Decade. His "three arrows" of reform intend to address Japan's chronically low inflation, decreasing worker productivity relative to other developed nations, and demographic issues raised by an aging population.<ref>{{Cite news|url = https://www.economist.com/news/leaders/21605905-shinzo-abe-has-best-chance-decades-changing-japan-better-he-seems-poised|title = The third arrow|last = |first = |date = June 28, 2014|work = |accessdate = }}</ref> Investor response to the announced reform was strong, and the [[Nikkei 225]] rallied to 20,000 in May 2015 from a low of around 9,000 in 2008. The Bank of Japan has set a 2% target for consumer-price inflation, although success has been hampered by a sales tax increase enacted to balance the government budget.<ref>{{Cite news|url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/economics/10929752/Inflation-in-Japan-rises-to-30-year-high.html|title = Inflation in Japan rises to 30-year high|last = |first = |date = June 27, 2014|work = |accessdate = }}</ref>
==See also== {{Portal|1990s|2000s}} * [[Economic history of Japan]] * [[Economic stagnation]] * [[Japanese post-war economic miracle]] * [[Political stagnation]] * [[Zero interest rate policy]]
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==Further reading== * Fletcher III, W. Miles, and Peter W. von Staden, eds. ''Japan's 'Lost Decade': Causes, Legacies and Issues of Transformative Change'' (Routledge, 2014) * Funabashi, Yoichi, and Barak Kushner, eds. ''Examining Japan's Lost Decades'' (Routledge, 2015) [http://samples.sainsburysebooks.co.uk/9781317503361_sample_1067437.pdf excerpt] * Hayashi, Fumio, and Edward C. Prescott. "The 1990s in Japan: A lost decade." ''Review of Economic Dynamics'' (2002) 5#1 pp: 206-235. [http://casee.asu.edu/upload/Prescott/2002-Hayashi-RED-The%201990s%20in%20Japan%20A%20Lost%20Decade.pdf online] {{Economy of Japan}}

{{Infobox spaceflight |name= Luna 25 |names_list= Luna-Glob lander<!--image of the spacecraft/mission--> |image=<!--omit the "file" prefix--> |image_caption=<!--image caption--> |image_alt=<!--image alt text--> |image_size=<!--include px/em; defaults to 220px-->
|mission_type= Technology, reconnaissance |operator= [[Roscosmos]] |COSPAR_ID= <!--spacecraft launched since 1963 only (aka NSSDC ID; eg. 1998-067A)--> |website= <!--Homepage of the craft/mission, OFFICIAL PAGES ONLY--> |mission_duration= 1 year (planned)<!--How long the mission lasted--> |distance_travelled= <!--How far the spacecraft travelled (if known)-->
<!--Spacecraft properties--> |spacecraft= <!--Spacecraft name/serial number (eg. Space Shuttle ''Discovery'', Apollo CM-118), etc--> |spacecraft_type= <!--eg. GPS Block II, Kobalt-M, US-K, etc--> |spacecraft_bus= <!--eg. A2100M, Star-2, etc--> |manufacturer= [[NPO Lavochkin]]<!--company or companies who built the satellite--> |launch_mass= 1,750 kg <ref name=gunters>{{Cite web|url=http://space.skyrocket.de/doc_sdat/luna-glob.htm|title=Luna-Glob (Luna 25)|website=space.skyrocket.de|access-date=2018-03-15}}</ref> <!--fuelled mass at launch, not including rocket or upper stage--> |BOL_mass= <!--spacecraft mass in orbit at beginning of operational life, after LEOP phase--> |landing_mass= <!--Mass after landing (recovered spacecraft only)--> |dry_mass= <!--spacecraft mass in orbit without fuel--> |payload_mass= <!--Mass of cargo carried by spacecraft (eg. for Space Shuttle), or total mass of instrumentation/equipment/experiments for mission--> |dimensions= <!--body dimensions and solar array span--> |power= <!--end-of-life power, in watts-->
<!--Launch details--> |launch_date= May 2021<ref name=russia /> |launch_rocket= [[Soyuz-2.1b]] / [[Fregat-M]]<ref name=russia /><ref name="Meet 2014"> {{cite conference |last=Mitrofanov |first=Igor |title="Luna-Glob” and “Luna-Resurs”: science goals, payload and status |url=http://meetingorganizer.copernicus.org/EGU2014/EGU2014-6696.pdf |format=PDF|conference=EGU General Assembly 2014 }}</ref> |launch_site= [[Baikonur Cosmodrome|Baikonur]] or [[Vostochny Cosmodrome|Vostochny]] |launch_contractor= <!--organisation(s) that conducted the launch (eg. United Launch Alliance, Arianespace, etc)-->
|interplanetary = <!--Infobox spaceflight/IP can be called multiple times for missions with multiple targets or combined orbiter/lander missions, etc--> {{Infobox spaceflight/IP |type = lander <!--flyby/orbiter/impactor/atmospheric/lander/rover -delete as appropriate, MUST BE ONE OF THESE OPTIONS--> |object = [[Moon]]<!--body visited - e.g. Jupiter, Venus, etc--> |orbits = <!--number of orbits completed at target body (if applicable and known)--> |component = <!--part of the spacecraft involved, if spacecraft split into multiple components--> |arrival_date = <!--Flybys: date/time of closest approach; Orbiters; orbital insertion date; Impactors/Landers/Rovers: impact/landing date/time; Atmospheric probes: atmospheric entry time--> |location = [[Boguslawsky (crater)|Boguslavsky crater]] <ref name='Russian Aviation'>[https://www.ruaviation.com/news/2018/1/25/10673/?h Russia’s Luna-25 lunar landing station scheduled for 2019]. ''Russian Aviation''. 25 January 2018.</ref> }}
<!--transponder parameters--> |trans_band= <!--Transponder frequency bands--> |trans_frequency= <!--specific frequencies--> |trans_bandwidth= <!--bandwidth--> |trans_capacity= <!--capacity of the transponders--> |trans_coverage=<!--area covered--> |trans_TWTA= <!--TWTA output power--> |trans_EIRP=<!--equivalent isotropic power--> |trans_HPBW=<!--half-power beam width-->
|programme=[[Luna-Glob]] |previous_mission= [[Luna 24]] |next_mission=[[Luna 26]] |insignia= <!--omit the "file" prefix--> |insignia_caption= <!--image caption--> |insignia_alt= <!--image alt text--> |insignia_size= <!--include px/em; defaults to 180px--> }}
'''Luna 25''' ('''Luna-Glob lander'''<ref name="LunarMissions">[http://www.planetary.org/explore/space-topics/space-missions/missions-to-the-moon.html Missions to the Moon] Luna-27. ''The Planetary Society''.</ref>) is a planned lunar [[Lander (spacecraft)|lander]] mission by the [[Russian Federal Space Agency]] (Roscosmos). It will land near the lunar south pole at the [[Boguslawsky (crater)|Boguslavsky]] crater.<ref name="gunters"></ref> It was renamed from Luna-Glob lander to Luna 25 to emphasize the continuity of the Soviet [[Luna programme]] from the 1970s, though it is still part of what was at one point conceptualized as the [[Luna-Glob]] lunar exploration program.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://de.sputniknews.com/wissen/20130408265891071-Russische-Mission-Luna-Glob-wird-in-Luna-25-umbenannt/|title=Russische Mission Luna-Glob wird in „Luna-25“ umbenannt|last=Sputnik|website=de.sputniknews.com|language=de|access-date=2017-11-21}}</ref> The launch is scheduled for May 2021.<ref name=russia>{{cite web |title=Russian Launch Manifest |url=http://www.sworld.com.au/steven/space/russia-man.txt |first=Steven |last=Pietrobon |date=11 July 2018 |access-date=11 July 2018}}</ref>
== History == Nascent plans for what is now Luna 25 began in the late 1990s, with the evaluation of two spacecraft designs having taken place by 1998. Attempts to revive and complete the project continued throughout the 2000s and were punctuated by an aborted attempt at international cooperation via a merger with [[JAXA]]'s now-cancelled [[Lunar-A]] orbiter, and pressure from another attempted cooperative lunar mission with [[ISRO]] (which [[Chandrayaan-2|continued without Russia's involvement]]).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.russianspaceweb.com/luna_glob.html|title=Luna-Glob|date=2017-12-11|work=Russian Space Web|accessdate=2018-03-15}}</ref>
Delays in the 2010s came first from the significant rework and delay brought on by the failure of [[Phobos-Grunt]] in 2011. This is the point at which the modern Luna 25 design was developed. Later, work on the lander was slowed by resource pressures being placed upon spacecraft developer [[NPO Lavochkin]], such as the weather satellite [[Elektro-L No.2]] and the [[Spektr-RG]] observatory<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.russianspaceweb.com/luna_glob_2013.html|title=Luna-Glob (Luna-25) project in 2013|date=2013-04-06|work=Russian Space Web|accessdate=2018-03-15}}</ref> as well the landing platform Russia is contributing to [[ExoMars 2020]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.russianspaceweb.com/luna-glob-status-2015.html|title=Development of the Luna-Glob project in 2014 and 2015|work=Russian Space Web|accessdate=2018-03-15}}</ref>
By 2017, the propulsion system for the spacecraft was in assembly.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.russianspaceweb.com/luna-glob-2017.html|title=Luna-Glob's stop and go|work=Russian Space Web|date=2017-12-15|accessdate=2018-03-15}}</ref>
== Mission == Initial mission plans called for a lander and orbiter, with the latter also deploying impact penetrators. In its current form, Luna 25 is a lander only, with a primary mission of proving out the landing technology. The mission will carry {{convert|30|kg|abbr=on}} of scientific instruments, including a robotic arm for soil samples and possible drilling hardware.<ref name="gunters"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.russianspaceweb.com/luna-glob-lander.html|title=Luna-Glob lander (Luna 25)|work=Russian Space Web|date=2015-10-08|accessdate=2018-03-15}}</ref><ref name=''>[https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/4936026/russia-unveils-30m-plans-to-start-mining-on-the-moon/ VLAD'S OVER THE MOON: Russia unveils £30m plans to start mining on the Moon]. Patrick Knox, ''The Sun''. 17 November 2017.</ref>
The launch is currently planned for May 2021 on a [[Soyuz-2.1b]] rocket with [[Fregat-M]] upper stage, from [[Baikonur Cosmodrome|Baikonur]] or [[Vostochny Cosmodrome|Vostochny]].<ref name=russia />

revision.text:
A '''metabibliography''' (or '''biblio-bibliography''') is a [[bibliography]] of bibliographies.
Bibliographies serve the finding of relevant documents. Metabibliographies serve the finding of the relevant bibliographies in which the relevant documents may be found. One might quote Patrick Wilson:
"For if knowledge is power, power over knowledge is power to increase one's power; and if the stock of writings is thought of mainly as it represents a stock of knowledge, it is natural to propose treating it as a "resource" to be subjected to rational control, managemenet and utilization." (Wilson, 1968, p. 145).
Metabibliographies are valuable for building reference collections, but usually of less interest to the average user, who rely on bibliographies selected by others.
==Examples==
* Balay, R. (Ed.). (1996). Guide to reference books. 11th ed. Chicago: American Library Association. Now as an online service: Guide to reference (2008- ). * Besterman, T. A. (1965-1966). A world bibliography of bibliographies and of bibliographical catalogues, calendars, abstracts, digests, indexes and the like. 4. Ed. Vol. 1-5. Totowa. * [[Bibliographic index]]. A cumulative bibliography of bibliographies. New York : Wilson, 1938-2011. Vol. 1-. (terminated). Retrieved from: http://www.hwwilson.com/Databases/biblio.htm * Carroll, B. A.; Fink, C. F. & Mohraz, J. E. (Eds.). (1983). Peace and war. A guide to bibliographies. Santa Barbara, Calif. : ABC-Clio. (War/peace bibliography series. #16 ). * "Dialindex" (File 411). Dialog. (See Dialog blue sheet: http://library.dialog.com/bluesheets/html/bl0411.html). * Gale Directory of online, portable, and internet databases. (See: Dialog blue sheet: dialog.com/bluesheets/html/bl0230.html). * Lester, R. (Ed.). (2005-). The New Walford Guide to reference resources Vol. 1-3. (Vol. 1, 2005: Science, Technology and Medicine. Vol. 2, 2007: The Social Sciences; Vol. 3, 2013: The Arts: Visual Arts, Music, Language and Literature. (1st edition published 1959). * Totok, W. & Weitzel, R. (Eds.). (1984-1985). Handbuch der bibliographischen Nachschlagewerke. Hrsg. v. Hans-Jürgen und Dagmar Kernchen. 6., erw., völlig neu bearb. Aufl. Frankfurt a.M. : Klostermann. (2 Vols). * Webb, W. H. et al. (Ed.). (1986). Sources of information in the social sciences. A Guide to the literature. 3. ed. Chicago : American Library Association.
==See also== * [[Bibliographic control]] * [[Guide to information sources]] (or: Bibliographic guide, literature guide, guide to reference materials subject gateway). * [[Wikipedia:List of bibliographies]] *[[List of lists of lists]]
==References== *Wilson, Patrick (1968). ''Two kinds of Power: an essay on bibliographical control.'' Berkeley, Calif.: University of California Press.

<!-- formerly "Miss Teen Competition" --> '''Miss Teen Continents''' is an annual international [[Beauty contest|beauty pageant]] held in the United States. It was formerly known as Miss Teen World. The name was changed after the legal issue between Miss World Organization and Miss Teen World organization.
Contestants of the pageant include teen girls, with one contestant from each country. The winner is a representative for teen girls around the world.

{{flagicon|Argentina}} [[Argentina]] | Tamara Navarro | 17 | Miss Teen Argentina | {{flagicon|USA}} [[Las Vegas, NV]] | 25 November 2017 | 50 |- |}
==Illegitimacy== {{Unreferenced section|date=June 2018}} The Miss Teen World Pageant was independently produced by Gaspar Cruz and the Miss Teen World Organization now called Miss Teen Continents.
Miss World Limited, the owner of a number of trade mark registrations for the mark MISS WORLD, won a judicial battle against a Teen pageant based in the USA. Among Miss World’s registrations is a United States trade mark for MISS WORLD (no. 877221), which was first registered on 5 April 1968. Therefore, there could never be a “Miss Teen World”, if not organized by the Miss World Organization.
Miss World Limited has extensively used and developed its brand over the past 60 years, which has become a famous and well-respected trademark. Over the years, many new pageants and so-called organizations have tried to take advantage of it (just like it happens with Miss Universe as well), so Miss World Limited has always strongly protected its brand and defended its long-standing exclusive rights to the MISS WORLD name and trade mark. After a two-year Federal Court lawsuit and trial in the United States, Miss World won it and the pageant formerly known as “Miss Teen World” produced by Gaspar Cruz has no right to use such name any longer.
The Court found in favor of the Miss World organisation on all its claims of federal trade mark infringement, dilution and unfair competition. Crucially, United States District Judge Vanessa D. Gilmore also found that as a result of Miss World’s continuous usage and promotion, “the MISS WORLD mark has become well-known and famous in the United States and internationally”.
The Court also went on to find that Mr Cruz’s use of the word “world” as part of his competitions as a trade marked name or as a title for his pageant winners caused actual confusion amongst the public and led to actual contempt of the Court’s earlier injunction.
The United States litigation highlighted Mr Cruz’s unauthorised international licensing of “Miss Teen World” where third parties are using the “Miss Teen World” name to run branded competitions in their own countries. The Court order enjoined Mr Cruz and all those acting in concert with or behalf of him from a number of activities including using the “Miss Teen World” name or any name which is similar to the MISS WORLD mark or likely to dilute its distinctive quality. Miss World Limited takes the protection of its intellectual property and famous brand very seriously and will take any required action against an infringer of its MISS WORLD mark. Such judicial decision should set an example and stop others from stealing intellectual property from Miss Universe, Miss World, or any other pageant.

[[Image:NBCUNICEFpromo.jpg|thumb|right|270px|The event was broadcast on NBC in the United States]]
'''The Music for UNICEF Concert: A Gift of Song''' was a [[benefit concert]] of [[popular music]] held in the [[United Nations General Assembly]] in [[New York City]] on January 9, 1979. It was intended to raise money for [[UNICEF]] world hunger programs and to mark the beginning of the [[International Year of the Child]]. The concert was [[videotape]]d and broadcast the following day on [[NBC]] in the U.S. and around the world. The moderator was [[David Frost]], with [[Gilda Radner]] and [[Henry Winkler]] also introducing some of the performers. [[Henry Fonda]] made a short appearance. Each performer signed a large parchment declaring support for UNICEF's goals.
The concert was the idea of impresario [[Robert Stigwood]], the [[Bee Gees]], and David Frost, who originally conceived it as an annual event. Not all of the performances were truly live, with [[ABBA]] [[lip-synching]] their new song "[[Chiquitita]]" and the [[Bee Gees]] lip-synching their song "[[Too Much Heaven]]". [http://felpin80.tripod.com/ata/1976-1979.html] It raised less than one million dollars at the time for UNICEF, although this figure did not include longer-term royalties from the songs and repeat performances.[http://nbc15.madison.com/entertainment/headlines/2168262.html]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}
==Performers== The Music for UNICEF Concert featured some of the biggest names in [[pop music]] at the time, and the performers donated their performance [[royalties]] and those from one song each to UNICEF. (The Bee Gees' song "[[Too Much Heaven]]", for example, had earned more than seven million dollars for UNICEF as of 2003). However, some artists released the royalties for only a limited time. Most of the songs performed were disco and not specifically about the issue of child poverty.
[[Elton John]] was scheduled to perform but did not appear.
A recording of the concert was released on an [[Gramophone record|LP]] on [[Polydor]] Records several weeks later, with the performances in a different running order.
*[[ABBA]] — "[[Chiquitita]]" *[[Bee Gees]] — "[[Too Much Heaven]]" *[[Andy Gibb]]— "[[Shadow Dancing (album)|I Go For You]]" *[[Andy Gibb]] and [[Olivia Newton-John]] — "[[Rest Your Love on Me]]" *[[Olivia Newton-John]] — "The Key" *[[John Denver]] — "[[Rhymes & Reasons (John Denver album)|Rhymes & Reasons]]" *[[Earth, Wind & Fire]] — "[[September (Earth, Wind & Fire song)|September]]" *[[Rita Coolidge]] and [[Kris Kristofferson]] — "Fallen Angels" *[[Rod Stewart]] — "[[Da Ya Think I'm Sexy?]]" *[[Donna Summer]] — "Mimi's Song"
There were also opening and closing songs, performed by all participants: *Opening medley, ending with part of ABBA's "[[He Is Your Brother]]" *Closing song: [[Jackie DeShannon]]'s "[[Put a Little Love in Your Heart]]"
==See also== *[[The Concert for Bangladesh]]
==External links== *[http://ddpro.ucoz.com/albums/79unicef/index.htm John Denver page with audio samples] *[http://www.onlyolivia.com/music/albums/data/unicef.html Olivia Newton-John page about the album] *[http://felpin80.tripod.com/ata/1976-1979.html ABBA page mentioning the concert] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20070311171754/http://www.wireimage.com/GalleryListing.asp?nbc1=1&navtyp=CAL====129051&ym=197901 Images of rehearsals] *[http://www.onlyolivia.com/visual/tv/70/79/unicef/index.html Screen shots] *{{IMDb title|id=0329115|title=The Music for UNICEF Concert: A Gift of Song}}
